title: Ask Sephyre
body:
Hey everyone,

I'm the creative services manager for OCE, our team works on things like Ocean Week, videos, esports promotion (like Fighting for OCE: http://oce.lolesports.com/content/2015-wildcard-invitational ), and a bunch of other stuff.

I'm also a huge fantasy/sci-fi fan and I consider Wheel of Time by Robert Jordan to be the best series ever. In my spare time I'm also working on a fantasy novel, hopefully it doesn't suck!

I can answer questions about publishing things, working at Riot OCE, and my obsession with building frozen heart on almost every champion. I can't guarantee I will know the answer to every question, but I'll do my best to answer!

replies.body: Can I borrow 20 bucks for lunch?
No.
Rito plz!

I have an obsession with rushing Double Doran's and Frozen Heart on Nidalee as support if we're vs'ing a few hefty Attack Damage dealers; being always in the fray and I love the mana, fee so cool having the item (must be the chill aura).

Do you think Pendragon will survive his epic quest and return from mount doom - to grace us with his presence and radiant awesomeness, or does he still require more time to gather ingredients in his quest to create more ravishing and fantastical summonings such as Rek'Sai of the Void and Teemo of butt-homo's'ville? (I assume he uses chemicals to summon them and various herbs and relics but I am still not sure as he has not said).

(I also assume the creation of items is just as magical - requiring epic journeys and summoning rituals; please don't disillusion me as to how Riot works). I just wish he would drop a line on OCE - the OCE Riot team seem cool (Drop bear pantheon just saying that's a good Australian icon - dunno how it fits into the other countries on OCE's server but oh well it was worth saying) - league has grown a lot. Can you tell us anything about the future of league and its content, do you see Champion production slowing down or massive changes to the meta coming?

I <3 fantasy books - reading one atm called the blood of eden series about a vampire girl, I love the writing too - very emotionally descriptive and to the point - and a little dark too. Congratulations on the Job at Riot. It's a great game and has a good professional community (the non-professional community have their moments). I miss NA's larger pool of players and some of the style of a lot of NA players, also the sweeping trends and mini-meta's but OCE has meta's of it's own - however it's still a sapling in comparison and I see it as developing more in uniquity and trends and ideas, I also see the OCE pro teams are doing very will in my opinion and hope OCE develops as strong a community as the NA server and hope to see them take the Championship this year or in years to come (Victorious drop bear pantheon noW) - but having played with a few high-rated NA players think they have their work cut out for them.

Are you enjoying your time with Riot - or is it hard work and does a lot of thinking and planning go into your job or the work around you, or is it really cruisy and made easier by a good chain of command and dereliction of duties, expectations and plans and ideas?

I can't really comment about the future development stuff, I don't work on the development team.

Re working here - loving every minute of it! It's definitely hard work but in a good way. I worked for a long time in media and that was good, but I've always wanted to work in the video game industry.

It's the opposite of cruisery, it's challenging but absolutely worth every second of it.

As a Rioter, is the feedback your receive from the community mostly positive or negative? 
And does this response impact or reflect in your work in any way?

Another question!
Is there any chance or plans of there being a studio/stadium/(whatever the correct term is) for the OPL matches with a live audience?

That would be awesome! The current studio downstairs doesn't have a live audience section, it would be awesome though. It's all about engagement with the OPL, if more people get into it then it can grow. There's little things everyone can do to help it along, watch the games with friends, post on the boards about what you think could be improved, jump on Facebook and give your favourite team a like so you can support them directly, etc. It all helps.
How do you feel about a walk through the jungle?
Haha, it makes me happy that a terrible Benji shotcall is becoming an internet meme.

Why did you change your name from riot sephyre to just sephyre?
Do you have any plans to bring back the weekly play with riot events and promote them as well?

I took Riot out of my name because I want to be closer to the true player experience and sometimes people act differently around the Riot tag. It's an optional thing for every Rioter, I could put it back.

Play with Riot was awesome! We could definitely try and do that again. It ran into some issues with scale last time and it sux if people don't get to play with a Rioter, but could be cool to revisit if there's enough interest.

ello^ {{champion:240}}  ~sneaking suspicions it was you {{champion:25}} 

Why are rioters always playing sinful succulence Morgana in ranked anyway?

Hey, weird question, cause it's to relate to ur work!
How do i (since im a student) try to get to do work experience at Riot games?
Just a really weird question!

We don't offer work experience here unfortunately :( Don't really have the scale to be able to.

If we did open them up, it will be announced on the boards etc, but to be honest I don't foresee this becoming a thing anytime soon here.

Same thing with internships for university students. NA has a few internship programs, you can check those out at www.riotgames.com/careers
Why doesn't your name have 'Riot' in front of it?

I want to be closer to the true player experience and some people act differently around the Riot tag.

I can put it back up, it's a personal choice for every Rioter.
Yes.

1. I have a bachelors in communication, but that was only part of the journey, I worked as a journalist and then a magazine editor for quite a few years before coming across to Riot.

2. Prefer over Riot? No :)

3. They are all listed here http://www.riotgames.com/articles/20150115/547/working-riot
Sephyre, I'm creative (as you've probably seen on PC) I was wondering, even though I'm not in Sydney what would be the chances of me getting a job at riot in the character creations department

Best place to start is www.riotgames.com/careers there is also a lot of good information on the linkedin group about the recruiting process.

Can't really speak for the champion design team, but keep an eye out on the North American roles, as that is where that team is based.

Back in original Starcraft (pre brood war) I needed a name to play online and thought I was super original and used Sephiroth from Final Fantasy 7. Then i logged in and realised I wasn't the only one.

The name kind of stuck though, everyone knew me as Seph, so I kept it and made it into Sephyre to make it my own :)

Whats the progress on our OCE skin?

It's still being worked on.  There's been many many concepts that went into initial exploration but never made it through. Some more heartbreaking than others when we get further down the process only to find a reason that it won't be suitable.
Thanks and best of luck to the team, Sephyre!

Or left over RP where you also cant do anything with like 42 RP.

Also, is it possible to get custom made Banners for our profile and/or Icons?

Custom banners for the boards or in game?
Both, Like Profile Banners and Something in/on our name.
Any love for twisted treeline coming to oce any time soon?
All of the queues are monitored and regularly evaluated. I understand the frustration on this one, I play 3s too.

Hey Sephyre, this may sound stupid but... this year i am expected to do work experience, would there be any chance Riot offers opportunities in the Sydney studio? Would love to hear back from you! XD
{{champion:17}}

Work experience is cool! I did mine at the RSPCA back in the day.

Re: work experience opportunities, we don't currently have the scale to offer that unfortunately and it's not something that would be likely to change anytime soon. We may one day though, and it would be announced on here if we did.

Same thing with internships.
You guys should have like a seperate studio for WE and internships, With the same stuff at your real studio but not for as many people :P
Can you release some ideas on what the OCE skin will be? or is it all top secret
Can't really give specifics, but i can tell you that almost every post on here, the old forums, reddit, facebook, etc about the server skin was read and the ideas out there looked into.

What's your favourite part about your job at Riot?

Also; What was the most memorable?

Going to work in the morning and truly believing in what we are doing.

Most memorable would have to be EB Expo 2013. I had only just started and getting to chat to hundreds if not thousands of players was a truly amazing and humbling experience.

Watching worlds with 3,000+ other people in that big hall on day 2 was pretty memorable as well.

@Sephyre 
How is your novel going :P? I feel like giving you a few tips which might be able to help you! 
Research the time period (helps makes it as realistic and accurate as possible)
Make it an interesting plot with some decent twists (not overly confusing, I notice a lot of authors write about things through the beginning/middle of the novel, and those things make it a whole lot more interesting or exciting chapters later.) 
Consider following the book through with a sequel
Keep characters one dimensional or have develop. 
Try your best not to copy other films/books, if you do make sure 0% of readers will be able to link it back to wherever it was from.
Decide the audience, they won't publish a novel intended for teens if it is too violent, overly violent novels should be directed at adults, imo.

Good tips :) i have one completed but it was done over many years and a bit of a mess. I use it as canon for my current effort.

I'm about 75,000 words in.
